citation.article-title: Description of Pseudaminobacter gen. nov. with two new species, Pseudaminobacter salicylatoxidans sp. nov. and Pseudaminobacter defluvii sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Pseudaminobacter salicylatoxidans sp. nov.
Pseudaminobacter salicylatoxidans (sa.li.cy.lat.oxi.dans. N. L. salicyclatoxidans oxidizing salicylate, because the organism oxidizes salicylate in an unusual manner)
Gram-negative, rod-shaped cells are 1-1.5 μm long by 0-5-0.8 μm wide, with rounded ends.
Forms circular, entire, slightly convex and smooth, glistening beige colonies with a diameter of 1-3 mm on nutrient agar (Oxoid).
Able to grow on nutrient agar (Oxoid), R2A agar (Oxoid) and TSB agar (BBL) at temperatures of 20-40°C.
The major polyamines are putrescine, spermidine and sym-homospermidine.
The overall polar lipid pattern was characterized by nearly the same amounts of the polar lipids PC, PG, PDE, PME, PE and DPG.
The cellular fatty acids include a large amount of straight-chain 18:1 acid.
The hydroxy acids include the hydroxylated fatty acid 15:0iso 3-OH.

The utilization of L-arabinose, D-cellobiose, D-galactose, D-mannose, sucrose, L-ornithine and L-serine (all negative for BN12T) and adonitol and cis-aconitate (positive for BN12T) allows differentiation from all Aminobacter species.
Hydrolysis of p-nitrophenyl α-D-glucopyranoside and p-nitrophenyl β-D-glucopyranoside is negative in contrast to all Aminobacter and Chelatobacter strains.
The utilization of L-ornithine and L-serine (all negative for BN12T) and D-maltose, D-trehalose, cis-aconitate, glutarate and L-malate (positive for BN12T) allows differentiation from THI 051T.
Other characteristics are shown in Tables 1 and 2.
The type strain is strain BN12T (=DSM 6986T).
The G + C content is 63.9 mol%.
